Message.CosmosCertificateRenewed: The TLS certificate for the following domains has been renewed: {{Vars}}
Message.ContainerUpdate: Container {{Vars}} updated to the latest version!

ConfirmPurgeMetrics: Are you sure you want to purge all the metrics data from the dashboards?

Infobox.AllowIndex: Enable this option if you have a public site and want to allow search engines to find it, so it appears on search results.
Infobox.OverwriteConfFile: This page allow you to edit the configuration file. Any Environment Variable overwritting configuration won't appear here.

BackupDirHelper: Directory where backups will be stored

Email.InfoEmail: This allow you to setup an SMTP server for Cosmos to send emails such as password reset emails and invites

AllowIndexHelper: Allow search engines to index your server
CoutryBlacklistIsWhitelist: Use list as whitelist instead of blacklist
WarningAllowHTTPLocalIPAccess:
This option is not recommended as it exposes your server to security risks on your local network.
Your local network is safer than the internet, but not safe, as devices like IoTs, smart-TVs, smartphones or even your router can be compromised.
If you want to have a secure offline / local-only access to a server that uses a domain name and HTTPS, use Constellation instead.
AllowInsecureAccessViaLocalIP: Allow insecure access via local IP
AllowHTTPLocalIPAccess: Allow insecure access via local IP
TooltipAllowHTTPLocalIPAccess:
When HTTPS is used along side a domain, depending on your networking configuration, it is possible that your server is not receiving direct local connections.
This option allows you to also access your Cosmos admin using your local IP address, like ip:port.
You can already create ip:port URLs for your apps, but this will make them HTTP-only.
HostnameLogin: Hostname: This will be used to restrict access to your Cosmos Server (Your IP, or your domain name)
WarningNotAdmin:
As you are not an admin, you can't edit the configuration.
This page is only here for visibility.
MongoDB-Login: MongoDB connection string. It is advised to use Environment variable to store this securely instead. (Optional)
ChooseBlockOrAllow: Choose which countries you want to block or allow
AdminRestrictionsDescr: Use those options to restrict access to the admin panel. Be careful, if you lock yourself out, you will need to manually edit the config file. To restrict the access to your local network, you can use the 'Admin Whitelist' with the IP range 192.168.0.0/16
AdminWhitelistIPs: Admin Whitelist Inbound IPs and/or IP ranges (comma separated)
AdminWhitelistIPsHelper: Comma separated list of IPs that will be allowed to access the admin panel
AdminConstellationOnly: Only allow access to the admin panel from the constellation
WarningChangePrivateKeysFromRemote: For security reasons, It is not possible to remotely change the Private keys of any certificates on your instance. It is advised to manually edit the config file, or better, use Environment Variables to store them.
GenerateMissingAuthCert: Generate missing Authentication Certificates automatically (Default: true)
SSLLetsEncrypt: Automatically generate certificates using Let's Encrypt (Recommended)
UseWildcard: Use Wildcard Certificate for the root domain of
OverrideWildcardDomains: (optional, only if you know what you are doing) Override Wildcard Domains (comma separated, need to add both wildcard AND root domain like in the placeholder)
DNSChallengeProvider: Pick a DNS provider (if you are using a DNS Challenge, otherwise leave empty)
ForceHTTPSCertificateRenewal: Force HTTPS Certificate Renewal On Next Save
NoAppsLong: You have no apps configured. Please add some apps in the configuration panel.
Name: Name
LastRunExitedOn: Last run exited with an error on
WarningContainerNotRunning: This container is not running. Editing any settings will cause the container to start again.
ByIPWhitelists: By IP Whitelists (Including restricted to Constellation)
BySmartShield: Smart Shield (various abuse metrics such as time, size, brute-force, concurrent requests, etc...). It does not include blocking for banned IP to save resources in case of potential attacks
infoStopAction: Stop action will attempt to stop/disable any resources (ex. Containers, routes, etc... ) attachted to the metric. This will only have an effect on metrics specific to a resources (ex. CPU of a specific container). It will not do anything on global metric such as global used CPU
infoRestartAction: Restart action will attempt to restart any Containers attachted to the metric. This will only have an effect on metrics specific to a resources (ex. CPU of a specific container). It will not do anything on global metric such as global used CPU
Throttle: Throttle (only triggers a maximum of once a day)
PeriodMetric: Period (how often to check the metric)
conditionPercent: Condition is a percent of max value
WarningUnofficialMarket: This app is not hosted on the Cosmos Cloud App Store. It is not officially verified and tested.
NoUpdateAvailable: No Update Available. Click to Force Pull
InfoSources1: This allows you to add additional 3rd party Cosmos app-markets to the market.
LogoutMsg: You have been logged off. Redirecting you...
WarningExperimental: This is an experimental feature. It is recommended to use with caution. Please report any issue you find!
SecretUpdated: Secret has been updated. Please copy it now as it will not be shown again.
PasswordResetCheckYourEmail: Check your email for a link to reset your password. If it doesn‚Äôt appear within a few minutes, check your spam folder.
unexpectedError: Unexpected error. Check your infos or try again later.
TargetTypeInfo: What are you trying to access with this route?
SourceInfo: What URL do you want to access your target from?
AdvancedUsersOnlyInfo: These settings are for advanced users only. Please do not change these unless you know what you are doing.
OverwriteHostHeader: Overwrite Host Header (use this to chain resolve request from another server/ip)
warningFilterIP: This setting will filter out all requests that do not come from the specified IPs. This requires your setup to report the true IP of the client. By default it will, but some exotic setup (like installing docker/cosmos on Windows, or behind Cloudlfare) will prevent Cosmos from knowing what is the client's real IP. If you used "Restrict to Constellation" above, Constellation IPs will always be allowed regardless of this setting.
WhitelistInboundIPs: Whitelist Inbound IPs and/or IP ranges (comma separated)
TerminalNotInteractiveInfo: This container is not interactive. If you want to connect to the main process,
PasteCompose: Paste your docker-compose.yml / cosmos-compose.json here or use the file upload button.
ImageUpdatedWarning: You have updated the image. Clicking the button below will pull the new image, and then only can you update the container.
RefreshNotUsingDomain: You are also not using a domain name, the server might go offline for a few seconds to remap your docker ports.
CertificateRenewalText1: You are using Let's Encrypt but you are not using the DNS Challenge with a wildcard certificate. This means the server has to renew the certificate everytime you add a new hostname, causing a few seconds of downtime. To avoid it in the future, please refer to
WarningTimeout: The server is taking longer than expected to restart.
WarningTimeoutLog: Consider troubleshouting the logs. If you use a self-signed certificate, you might have to refresh and re-accept it.
Restart?: Do you want to restart your server?
FormInviteUser: Use this form to invite a new user to the system.
EditInvitedEmail: Use this form to invite edit <1></1>\'s Email.
ConfirmDeleteUser: Are you sure you want to delete user
AlternativeShareThisLink: Alternatively you can also share the link below:
CreateCustomJob: Create a custom job to run a shell command in a container. Leave the container field empty to run on the host
OnHostOnlyWorksIfCosmosIsNotInAContainer: Running on the host only works if Cosmos is not itself running in a container
ContainerNotRunning: This container is not running. Editing any settings will cause the container to start again.
ContainerNotRunningEdit: This container is not running. Editing any settings will cause the container to start again.
ContainerForcedSecureNetwork: This container is forced to be secured. You cannot expose any ports to the internet directly, please create a URL in Cosmos instead. You also cannot connect it to the Bridge network.
ConnectedToRemovedNetwork: You are connected to a network that has been removed:
CosmosOutdated: This service requires a newer version of Cosmos. Please update Cosmos to install this service.
PasswordResetNotAllowed: This server does not allow password reset.
NotLoggedIn: You need to be logged in to access this
DisconnectPleaseLogin: You have been disconnected. Please login to continue
WrongLogin: Wrong nickname or password. Try again or try resetting your password
AccountUnconfirmed: You have not yet registered your account. You should have an invite link in your emails. If you need a new one, contact your administrator.
WelcomeText: First of all, thanks a lot for trying out Cosmos! And Welcome to the setup wizard. This wizard will guide you through the setup of Cosmos. It will take about 2-3 minutes and you will be ready to go.
CleanInstall: Clean install (remove any existing config files)
WhatIsCosmos: Cosmos is using docker to run applications. It is optional, but Cosmos will run in reverse-proxy-only mode if it cannot connect to Docker.
CosmosDatabaseText: Cosmos is using a MongoDB database to store all the data. It is optional, but Authentication as well as the UI will not work without a database.
HTTPSDescription: It is recommended to use Let's Encrypt to automatically provide HTTPS Certificates. This requires a valid domain name pointing to this server. If you don't have one, you can select "Generate self-signed certificate" in the dropdown. If you enable HTTPS, it will be effective after the next restart.
LetsEncryptOnlyAcceptsDomains: Let\'s Encrypt only accepts domain names
CheckInput: Please check you have filled all the inputs properly
HostnameText: Hostname (How would you like to access Cosmos?)
SeemsDomain: You seem to be using a domain name.
LetsEncryptAuto: Let's Encrypt can automatically generate a certificate for you.
SeemsLocal: You seem to be using an IP address or local domain.
SelfSignedAuto: You can use automatic Self-Signed certificates.
AdminAccountText: Create a local admin account to manage your server. Email is optional and used for notifications and password recovery.
WildcardLetsEncrypt: You have enabled wildcard certificates with Let's Encrypt. This only works if you use the DNS challenge! Please edit the DNS Provider text input.
ServAppURL: Create a URL to access this ServApp
CosmosInsideContainer: You are running Cosmos inside a Docker container. As such, it will only have limited access to your disks and their informations.
ExternalStorageDesc: Coming soon. This feature will allow you to mount external cloud (Dropbox, Onedrive, ...) to your server.
SharesDesc: Coming soon. This feature will allow you to share folders with different protocols (SMB, FTP, ...)
RAIDDesc: Coming soon. This feature will allow you to create RAID arrays with your disks.
confirmParityDelete: Are you sure you want to delete this parity?
ErrorNoSMART: No S.M.A.R.T. data available for this disk. If you are running Cosmos behind some sort of virtualization or containerization, it is probably the reason why the data is not available.
SMARTThreshhold: This value is a % of health (100 is best). Next to them is a threshold below which it is urgent to replace your hardrive.
NameAtLeast3Chars: Name should be at least 3 characters
ParityStep2: Select the data disks you want to protect with the parity disk(s).
ParityStep3: Set the sync and scrub intervals. The sync interval is the time at which parity is updated. The scrub interval is the time at which the parity is checked for errors. This is using the CRONTAB syntax with seconds.
ConstellationExternalNetwork: You are currently connected to an external constellation network. Use your main Cosmos server to manage your constellation network and devices.
ResetnetworkText: This will completely reset the network, and disconnect all the clients. You will need to reconnect them. This cannot be undone.
PrivateNode: This node is Private (no public IP)
FirewallText: Coming soon. This feature will allow you to open and close ports individually on each device and decide who can access them.
UnsafeRoutesText: Coming soon. This feature will allow you to tunnel your traffic through your devices to things outside of your constellation.
DNSText: This is a DNS that runs inside your Constellation network. It automatically rewrites your domains DNS entries to be local to your network, and also allows you to do things like block ads and trackers on all devices connected to your network. You can also add custom DNS entries to resolve to specific IP addresses. This DNS server is only accessible from inside your network.
DNSExpiryWarning: When changing your DNS records, always use private mode on your browser and allow some times for various caches to expire.
DeviceAdded: Device added successfully! Download scan the QR Code from the Cosmos app or download the relevant files to your device along side the config and network certificate to connect:
AddDeviceConstellation: Add a Device to the constellation using either the Cosmos or Nebula client
TokenMin6Char: Token must be at least 6 characters
TokenMax6Char: Token must be at most 6 characters
ExampleOTP: For example FreeOTP(+) or Google/Microsoft authenticator
OTPManualCode: ...Or enter this code manually in it
OTPEnterToken: Once you have scanned the QR code or entered the code manually, enter the token from your authenticator app below
UnmountDiskText: You are about to unmount following disk
UnmountDiskText2: This will make the content unavailable to be viewed in the file explorer.
UnmountDiskText3: Permanent Unmount will persist after reboot.
MountDiskText3: Permanent Mount will persist after reboot.
MountDiskText2: This will make the content available to be viewed in the file explorer.
MountDiskText: You are about to Mount following disk
UnmountText: You are about to unmount a Folder
UnmountText2: This will make the content unavailable to be viewed in the file explorer.
UnmountText3: Permanent Unmount will persist after reboot.
MountText3: Permanent Mount will persist after reboot.
MountText2: This will make the content available to be viewed in the file explorer.
MountText: You are about to Mount a Folder
DatabaseCantConnect: Database cannot connect, this will impact multiple feature of Cosmos. Please fix ASAP!
LetsEncryptEmailError: You have enabled Let's Encrypt for automatic HTTPS Certificate. You need to provide the configuration with an email address to use for Let's Encrypt in the configs.
LetsEncryptErrors: There are errors with your Let's Encrypt configuration or one of your routes, please fix them as soon as possible:
NewCosmosVersion: A new version of Cosmos is available! Please update to the latest version to get the latest features and bug fixes.
CosmosNotDockerHost: Your Cosmos server is not running in the docker host network mode. It is recommended that you migrate your install.
ConfigChangeReqRestart: You have made changes to the configuration that require a restart to take effect. Please restart Cosmos to apply the changes.
LocalhostNotRecommended: You are using localhost or 0.0.0.0 as a hostname in the configuration. It is recommended that you use a domain name or an IP instead.
MigrationSucess: Migration successful! Your Cosmos instance will now restart in Host Mode. Refresh the page to see the changes (it might take a few minutes!). If you are experiencing issues, please check the logs for more information.
SelectWhatDelete: Select what you wish to delete:
